level.text: Except as provided in § 9005.2, a dental assistant shall not place or expose dental x-ray film unless he or she has:
Successfully passed the Dental Assisting National Board’s (DANB) Radiation Health and Safety (RHS) examination or Certified Dental Assistant (CDA) examination; or
Successfully completed a dental radiography training program approved by the Board.
Notwithstanding § 9005.1, a dentist may permit an assistant to place or expose dental x-ray film if:
The assistant has completed in-office training;
The assistant has demonstrated competency to perform the task to the supervising dentist’s satisfaction; and
The assistant registers no later than September 17, 2012.
